item.title: Really need help
item.dc:creator: @Full_metal_jacket Full metal jacket
item.description:
@Full_metal_jacket wrote:

the addglobalobject and the makeglobalobject are 2 different things =p

First
Search for:

makeGlobalObject

keep going untill you find one that looks like:

makeGlobalObject(2451, 2458, 362, -1, 10);

thats where you add objects like portals and walls ect.

item.title: Really need help
item.dc:creator: @link1011 link1011
item.description:
@link1011 wrote:

client.java:12579: cannot find symbol symbol : method addGlobalobject(int,int,int,int,int) location: class client addGlobalobject(2731, 3465, 2038, 0, 10);//Dummy ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .

I have no idea what to do. I have tried all I know. I read the global objects TUT, and there is nothing there that I don’t have. I ahve followed everything step by step. Here is what my client.java looks like around the issue

[code]public void makeGlobalObject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int

tileObjectType){ //Makes Global objects
for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players){
if(p != null){
client person = (client)p;
if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != “null”)){
if(person.distanceToPoint(x, y) <= 60){
person.createNewTileObject(x, y, typeID,

orientation, tileObjectType);
}
}
}
}
}

public void NewObjects() {
makeGlobalObject(2731, 3465, 2038, 0, 10);//Dummy
addGlobalobject(2731, 3465, 2038, 0, 10);//Dummy
}

public void removeAllItems() {
	for (int i = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++) {
		playerItems[i] = 0;
	}
	for (int i = 0; i < playerItemsN.length; i++) {
		playerItemsN[i] = 0;
	}
	resetItems(3214);
}[/code]

Read full topic
